title: International Symposium on Weather and Climate Extremes, Food Security and Biodiversity
description: Are weather extremes part of a new normal in climate patterns? • Will increasing extremes in weather and climate fundamentally alter the collective ability of the global agricultural system to feed the world’s population? • Can plant and animal species adapt to rapid changes in climate? How to cope with these and other issues related to the changing nature of weather and climate extremes are discussed at the International Symposium on Weather and Climate Extremes, Food Security and Biodiversity.

venue.venue: Campus of George Mason University, Washington, DC, USA
